allow_no_indices.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

human.description: Whether to return time and byte values in human-readable format.

wait_for_completion.description: Specify whether the request should block until the all segments are upgraded (default: true)

only_ancient_segments.description: If true, only ancient (an older Lucene major release) segments will be upgraded

index.description: A comma-separated list of index names to restrict the operation; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

type.description: A comma-separated list of document types to restrict the operation; leave empty to perform the operation on all types

explain.description: Return detailed information about the error

q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax

analyzer.description: The analyzer to use for the query string

analyze_wildcard.description: Specify whether wildcard and prefix queries should be analyzed (default: false)

default_operator.description: The default operator for query string query (AND or OR)

df.description: The field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string

lenient.description: Specify whether format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) should be ignored

lowercase_expanded_terms.description: Specify whether query terms should be lowercased

rewrite.description: Provide a more detailed explanation showing the actual Lucene query that will be executed.

body.description: The query definition specified with the Query DSL

index.description: The name of the index

type.description: The type of the document

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return in the response

preference.description: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

realtime.description: Specify whether to perform the operation in realtime or search mode

refresh.description: Refresh the shard containing the document before performing the operation

_source.description: True or false to return the _source field or not, or a list of fields to return

_source_exclude.description: A list of fields to exclude from the returned _source field

_source_include.description: A list of fields to extract and return from the _source field

body.description: Document identifiers; can be either `docs` (containing full document information) or `ids` (when index and type is provided in the URL.

index.description: The name of the index

type.description: The type of the document (use `_all` to fetch the first document matching the ID across all types)

max_doc_freq.description: The word occurrence frequency as count: words with higher occurrence in the corpus will be ignored

max_query_terms.description: The maximum query terms to be included in the generated query

max_word_length.description: The minimum length of the word: longer words will be ignored

min_doc_freq.description: The word occurrence frequency as count: words with lower occurrence in the corpus will be ignored

min_term_freq.description: The term frequency as percent: terms with lower occurence in the source document will be ignored

min_word_length.description: The minimum length of the word: shorter words will be ignored

mlt_fields.description: Specific fields to perform the query against

percent_terms_to_match.description: How many terms have to match in order to consider the document a match (default: 0.3)

search_from.description: The offset from which to return results

search_indices.description: A comma-separated list of indices to perform the query against (default: the index containing the document)

search_size.description: The number of documents to return (default: 10)

search_source.description: A specific search request definition (instead of using the request body)

search_types.description: A comma-separated list of types to perform the query against (default: the same type as the document)

stop_words.description: A list of stop words to be ignored

body.description: A specific search request definition

index.description: The index of the document being count percolated to use as default

type.description: The type of the document being percolated to use as default.

allow_no_indices.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

body.description: The percolate request definitions (header & body pair), separated by newlines

index.description: A comma-separated list of index names to use as default

type.description: A comma-separated list of document types to use as default

body.description: The request definitions (metadata-search request definition pairs), separated by newlines

index.description: The index in which the document resides.

type.description: The type of the document.

ids.description: A comma-separated list of documents ids. You must define ids as parameter or set "ids" or "docs" in the request body

term_statistics.description: Specifies if total term frequency and document frequency should be returned. Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

field_statistics.description: Specifies if document count, sum of document frequencies and sum of total term frequencies should be returned. Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

offsets.description: Specifies if term offsets should be returned. Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

positions.description: Specifies if term positions should be returned. Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

payloads.description: Specifies if term payloads should be returned. Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

preference.description: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random) .Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

routing.description: Specific routing value. Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

parent.description: Parent id of documents. Applies to all returned documents unless otherwise specified in body "params" or "docs".

realtime.description: Specifies if requests are real-time as opposed to near-real-time (default: true).

body.description: Define ids, parameters or a list of parameters per document here. You must at least provide a list of document ids. See documentation.

node_id.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs or names to limit the returned information; use `_local` to return information from the node you're connecting to, leave empty to get information from all nodes

interval.description: The interval for the second sampling of threads

snapshots.description: Number of samples of thread stacktrace (default: 10)

threads.description: Specify the number of threads to provide information for (default: 3)

ignore_idle_threads.description: Don't show threads that are in known-idle places, such as waiting on a socket select or pulling from an empty task queue (default: true)

type.description: The type to sample (default: cpu)

node_id.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs or names to limit the returned information; use `_local` to return information from the node you're connecting to, leave empty to get information from all nodes

metric.description: A comma-separated list of metrics you wish returned. Leave empty to return all.

flat_settings.description: Return settings in flat format (default: false)

human.description: Whether to return time and byte values in human-readable format.

node_id.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs or names to perform the operation on; use `_local` to perform the operation on the node you're connected to, leave empty to perform the operation on all nodes

delay.description: Set the delay for the operation (default: 1s)

exit.description: Exit the JVM as well (default: true)

metric.description: Limit the information returned to the specified metrics

index_metric.description: Limit the information returned for `indices` metric to the specific index metrics. Isn't used if `indices` (or `all`) metric isn't specified.

node_id.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs or names to limit the returned information; use `_local` to return information from the node you're connecting to, leave empty to get information from all nodes

completion_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields for `fielddata` and `suggest` index metric (supports wildcards)

fielddata_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields for `fielddata` index metric (supports wildcards)

groups.description: A comma-separated list of search groups for `search` index metric

level.description: Return indices stats aggregated at node, index or shard level

types.description: A comma-separated list of document types for the `indexing` index metric

type.description: The type of the document being percolated.

expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.
